pluggable.operation
Interface Operation

All Known Subinterfaces:
FilterOperation
All Known Implementing Classes:
Accessible, Coaccessible, Conflicting, Containment, Controllable, Meet, PrefixClosure, Projection, SupCon, SynchronousProduct, Trim
public interface Operation

Interface for DES operations.

Author:
Lenko Grigorov

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Name of the operation. The same string will be used to index and identify the operation as well as for display purposes.

Returns:
the name of the operation

getNumberOfInputs

int getNumberOfInputs()
Nuber of inputs for the operation. If it can handle an unbounded number of inputs, return -1.

Returns:
nuber of inputs for the operation; -1 if unbounded

getTypeOfInputs

java.lang.Class[] getTypeOfInputs()
Class types of the inputs. If the inputs are unbounded, the last supplied class type will be assumed for all inputs with a higher index. E.g., if {Boolean,FSAModel} are supplied, the first input will be Boolean and all remaining inputs are assumed to be of type FSAModel. This type extension is applied only when the number of inputs is unbounded (i.e., when getNumberOfInputs() returns -1).

Whenever possible, please use the general interfaces from the package model.* (such as FSAModel) instead of specific implementations.

Returns:
class types of the inputs
See Also:
getNumberOfInputs(), getDescriptionOfInputs()

getDescriptionOfInputs

java.lang.String[] getDescriptionOfInputs()
User-readable and understandable description for each input argument. If the inputs are unbounded, the last supplied description will be assumed for all inputs with a higher index. E.g., if {"String 1","String 2"} are supplied, the first input will be described to the user as "String 1" and all remaining inputs will be described as "String 2". This type extension is applied only when the number of inputs is unbounded (i.e., when getNumberOfInputs() returns -1).

Returns:
user-readable descriptions of the inputs
See Also:
getNumberOfInputs()

getNumberOfOutputs

int getNumberOfOutputs()
Nuber of outputs from the operation.

Returns:
nuber of outputs from the operation

getTypeOfOutputs

java.lang.Class[] getTypeOfOutputs()
Class types of the outputs.

Whenever possible, please use the general interfaces from the package model.* (such as FSAModel) instead of specific implementations.

Returns:
class types of the inputs
See Also:
getNumberOfOutputs(), getDescriptionOfOutputs()

getDescriptionOfOutputs

java.lang.String[] getDescriptionOfOutputs()
User-readable and understandable description for each output argument.

Returns:
user-readable descriptions of the outputs
See Also:
getNumberOfOutputs()

perform

java.lang.Object[] perform(java.lang.Object[] inputs)
Perform the operation.

Parameters:
inputs - inputs to the operation (must conform to the types described in getTypeOfInputs())
Returns:
outputs of the operation (must conform to the types described in getTypeOfOutputs())
